oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:title: Grand Ole Opry - Prince Albert - 1960-03-05 - Part 2
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:description: Part 2 of Prince Albert tobacco sponsored Grand Ole Opry segment from March 5, 1960. Featuring Grant Turner (announcer), Faron Young (host/performer), guest performers Cousin Jody and his Country Cousins, and regular performers Archie Campbell, Tommy Jackson, Chet Atkins, Minnie Pearl, and Stringbean. Held at Ryman Auditorium, Nashville, TN. It is announced that TV Radio Mirror Magazine presented the Opry the award for best country music program on the air, and that this is the 1065th broadcast.
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:creator: Chet Atkins; Minnie Pearl; Faron Young; Cousin Jody; Country Cousins; Stringbean
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dcterms:tableOfContents: Faron Young introduces Chet Atkins -- Hot Mockingbird (Chet Atkins) -- Faron Young introduces Minnie Pearl -- Comedy routine (Minnie Pearl, Faron Young) -- The Proof Is In The Puffing (Faron Young) (recording) -- Grant Turner introduces Cousin Jody -- Lady Cop (Cousin Jody and his Country Cousins) -- Faron Young introduces Stringbean -- Train Forty-Five (Stringbean) -- Grant Turner and Faron Young announce his tour schedule -- I'll Be Alright (In The Morning) (Faron Young) -- Closing theme -- Closing statement (Faron Young) -- Camel Cigarettes jingle -- Network announcements (Grant Turner)
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:subject: WSM (Radio station : Nashville, Tenn.); National Broadcasting Company; Grand ole opry (Radio program); Ryman Auditorium (Nashville, Tenn.); United States.
